perturbation.original_text: 8. You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code 20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text: 8. You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. By signing this agreement, you waive all rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516) and the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.explanation: This modification directly contradicts California Corporation Code 31512 and Business and Professions Code 20010, which explicitly void waivers of rights under the Franchise Investment Law and the Franchise Relations Act. The changed text enforces a waiver that is legally invalid under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Corporation Code 31512 and Business and Professions Code 20010

perturbation.original_text: 9. THE CALIFORNIA FRANCHISE INVESTMENT LAW REQUIRES THAT A COPY OF ALL PROPOSED AGREEMENTS RELATING TO THE SALE OF THE FRANCHISE BE DELIVERED TOGETHER WITH THE DISCLOSURE DOCUMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. The franchisee acknowledges that delivery of proposed agreements relating to the sale of the franchise together with the disclosure document is optional and at the sole discretion of the franchisor.
perturbation.explanation: This modification contradicts the California Franchise Investment Law, which mandates that all proposed agreements relating to the sale of the franchise be delivered with the disclosure document. By making this delivery optional, the modified text violates this legal requirement.

perturbation.original_text: 10. The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause. Under California Civil Code Section 1671, certain liquidated damages clauses are unenforceable.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause. The parties agree that the liquidated damages clause is fully enforceable regardless of California Civil Code Section 1671.
perturbation.explanation: California Civil Code Section 1671 limits the enforceability of liquidated damages clauses. This change declares the clause fully enforceable, directly conflicting with the legal limitations imposed by Section 1671.
